DOCNAME: GERAGUYN KHORHURD PATGAMAVORAKAN AKUMB v. ARMENIA
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Elisabet Fura;Josep Casadevall
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , ORG , is a non - governmental organisation ( “ the applicant organisation ” ) which was established in DATE and has its registered office in GPE . It was represented before the ORG by its head , PERSON . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr G. Kostanyan , Representative of GPE at ORG .
CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . On DATE a parliamentary election was held in GPE . The applicant organisation acted as an election observer during the election . According to the applicant organisation , in the pre - election stage it had disclosed numerous violations connected with the use of pre - election funds of certain parties which allegedly led to the free broadcast of the election campaign by certain TV companies being carried out mainly in favour of a number of parties .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant organisation alleged that on CARDINAL DATE its head had applied to ORG ( ՀՀ կենտրոնական ընտրական հանձնաժողով – “ the ORG ” ) with letter no . CARDINAL , sent by registered mail , having the following content :
“ To receive copies of documents
To ORG
Application

Based on the requirements of LAW ( CARDINAL ) of LAW of GPE and Paragraph CARDINAL of LAW , I request that an observer of our organisation [ GPE ] be allowed , according to the established procedure , to receive copies of a number of documents related to the parliamentary election of DATE , in particular :
CARDINAL . NORP all decisions taken by the ORG after DATE ] ;
CARDINAL . NORP all records of the meetings held by the ORG after DATE ] ; [ and ]

CARDINAL . NORP registers of voluntary payments to pre - election funds and expenses of the parties ( unions of parties ) participating in the parliamentary election through the proportionate ballot . ”

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant organisation further alleged that on CARDINAL DATE the lawyer of the ORG verbally informed its head that the ORG still had time to reply to its request . It also alleged that on the same date its head addressed to the Chairman of the ORG letter no . CARDINAL , similarly by registered mail , which stated as follows :
“ ... on DATE [ DATE ] we applied to the ORG requesting to be allowed to receive copies of a number of documents related to the parliamentary election of DATE .
However , so far you have not satisfied our lawful request[. I]n this connection we once again request [ that you ] provide us with copies of the documents in question . ”
CARDINAL . The Government contested these allegations and argued that the letters in question were never submitted to the ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant organisation contested the ORG ’s alleged inaction before the courts , seeking to oblige it to provide copies of the requested documents .
CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE and ORG of GPE ( Երևան քաղաքի Կենտրոն և Նորք-Մարաշ համայնքների առաջին ատյանի դատարան ) held a hearing on the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE and ORG of GPE held another hearing and decided to dismiss the applicant organisation ’s application . ORG found that the applicant organisation had failed to submit any evidence that it had applied to the ORG with a request for copies of documents and had been refused .
CARDINAL . The applicant organisation alleged that it had not been notified about these hearings and its representative was therefore unable to attend .

CARDINAL . On DATE a copy of this judgment was served on the applicant organisation . On DATE , the head of the applicant organisation requested access to the materials of the case file . The applicant organisation alleged that no reply was received to this request , while the Government alleged that this request was never actually filed with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the head of the applicant organisation , in reply to another request , was granted access to the case file materials .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant organisation lodged an appeal . Attached to its appeal the applicant organisation submitted copies of its letters of CARDINAL and CARDINAL DATE and of front pages of CARDINAL post office receipts .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( ՀՀ քաղաքացիական գործերով վերաքննիչ դատարան ) , with reference to ORG DATE of the Code of Civil Procedure , decided to dismiss the applicant organisation ’s appeal on the ground that it had failed to submit evidence that it had sent its letter of CARDINAL DATE to the ORG . ORG found that the copy of the post office receipt attached to the appeal could not serve as such proof because there was no postmark on it certifying that the letter had been handed in at the relevant post office .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant organisation submitted that its representative refused to participate in this hearing because of allegedly having previously been denied access to the case file materials .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant organisation lodged an appeal on points of law . Attached to its appeal the applicant organisation submitted copies of the same post office receipts with postmarks dated CARDINAL and CARDINAL DATE photocopied on their reverse .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( ՀՀ վճռաբեկ դատարան ) dismissed the applicant organisation ’s appeal . ORG , having recapitulated the findings of ORG , stated , inter alia :

“ As regards the argument raised in the appeal that letters ORG . CARDINAL and CARDINAL have been sent , the [ post office ] receipts submitted as proof are not proper evidence since they bear no postmarks . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW , as in force at the material time , read as follows :
“ CARDINAL . Elections are prepared and conducted publicly . ... ”

“ CARDINAL . [ The following physical and legal persons ] have the right to an observer mission during an election : ( CARDINAL ) international organisations ; ( CARDINAL ) representatives of foreign states ; [ and ] ( CARDINAL ) those [ domestic ] and foreign non - governmental organisations whose statutory aims include questions of democracy and human rights protection and which do not support [ any of ] the candidates or the parties .
CARDINAL . NORP The procedure for carrying out an observer mission shall be established by ORG . ”
“ CARDINAL . Organisations and persons mentioned in LAW may carry out an observer mission after having been accredited by ORG .
CARDINAL . The powers of persons carrying out an observer mission shall terminate DATE after the end of an election . ”

“ CARDINAL . An authorised election assistant , an observer and a representative of mass media have the right : ... ( CARDINAL ) to have unimpeded access to the election documents , samples of ballot papers , decisions of an election committee and records of its meetings , as well as to receive their copies and to take extracts .
CARDINAL . No limitations can be placed on the rights of an authorised election assistant , an observer and a mass media representative . ... ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW , as in force at the material time , read as follows :
“ Any party to the proceedings must prove the circumstances on which his [ or her ] claims and objections are based . ”
“ CARDINAL . Evidence shall be produced by the parties to the proceedings . ... ”

“ Unlawful acts of public authorities , local self - government bodies and their officials can be annulled or their actions ( inaction ) can be contested ( hereafter , annulling the unlawful act ) if the act in question contradicts the law and if there is evidence that the applicant ’s rights and ( or ) freedoms guaranteed by LAW and laws have been violated . ”

“ CARDINAL . An application seeking to annul unlawful acts of public authorities , local self - government bodies and their officials shall be submitted to a court dealing with civil cases or ORG , pursuant to their jurisdiction over cases . ... ”
“ Cases on appeals lodged against judgments of the first instance courts , which have not entered into force , are examined by ORG ( hereafter , ORG ) . ”
“ CARDINAL . ORG is not bound by the appeal and shall examine the case anew on the basis of the existing and newly produced evidence . ... ”

“ Appeals on points of law lodged against judgments of the first instance courts , ORG and ORG , which have entered into force , and judgments of ORG and ORG , which have not entered into force , are examined by ORG ( hereafter , ORG ) . ”
“ An appeal on points of law can be lodged on the ground of ... a substantive or a procedural violation of the parties’ rights ... ”

“ CARDINAL . ORG is not entitled to establish or consider as proven facts which have not been established by the contested judgment or have been rejected by it , to determine whether or not this or that piece of evidence is reliable , to resolve the issue as to which piece of evidence has more weight or the issue as to which norm of substantive law must be applied and what kind of judgment must be adopted upon the new examination of the case . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the Rules , in force at the material time , read as follows :

“ CARDINAL . An observer has the right : ... to have unimpeded access to the election documents , samples of ballot papers , decisions of an election committee and records of its meetings , as well as to receive their copies and to take extracts ; ... to give press conferences and to address mass media in accordance with the legislation of GPE .
CARDINAL . An observer shall submit copies of the reports on the summarising of the election results and on the conduct of the election to ORG ... ”
“ CARDINAL . The material and financial costs of an observer ’s activities shall be borne by the party commissioning the observer or by [ the observer ’s ] own financial means .
CARDINAL . The relevant election committees shall provide the necessary assistance to an observer in the implementation of the rights envisaged by LAW . ”
